feature: Create README.md with project overview and setup instructions
description: The repository has no README.md file, which is the primary entry point for anyone viewing the project on GitHub. This is critical for a portfolio site targeting AI company recruiters who may check GitHub presence.
summary: Add a professional README.md to establish clear project documentation for a personal portfolio site targeting AI company recruiters. The README will explain the site's purpose, technologies used, local development setup, and deployment workflow.

phases.name: Research & Structure
phases.description: Analyze existing codebase and define README sections

subtasks.title: Define README structure and sections
subtasks.description: Based on codebase analysis, determine the optimal structure for the README including: project overview, tech stack, setup instructions, deployment, and project structure sections
subtasks.notes: Analyzed codebase and defined optimal README structure with 10 sections: Header, Overview, Tech Stack, Features, Project Structure, Local Development, Deployment, Development Notes, License, and Author/Contact. Structure documented in build-progress.txt with rationale.

subtasks.title: Create README.md with project header and overview
subtasks.description: Write the README header with project title, brief description, and badges (if applicable). Include overview section explaining this is a personal portfolio site for Abe Diaz, targeting AI company recruiters at Anthropic, OpenAI, and DeepMind.

subtasks.title: Add tech stack section
subtasks.description: Document the technologies used: static HTML/CSS, Oswald Google Font, responsive design, GitHub Pages hosting, and GitHub Actions CI/CD.

subtasks.title: Add local development section
subtasks.description: Document how to clone the repository and run the site locally. Since this is a static site, explain options like opening index.html directly or using a simple local server.

subtasks.title: Add deployment section
subtasks.description: Document the GitHub Pages deployment workflow, including how the GitHub Actions pipeline works and how the custom domain (abediaz.ai) is configured.

subtasks.title: Add project structure section
subtasks.description: Document the project's file structure including index.html, images folder, CNAME, GitHub workflows, and docs folder.
acceptance_criteria: All key files and directories documented

subtasks.title: Add license and contact sections
subtasks.description: Add license information and contact/social links for the site owner to complete the README.

subtasks.title: Review README for completeness and formatting
subtasks.description: Verify the README is well-formatted, all links work, and content is clear and professional. Ensure it reflects well on the site owner as a technical portfolio piece.
